intro: Dioscorea matsudae, commonly known as the Japanese yam, is a perennial vine native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Dioscoreaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and tuberous roots. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its tubers are used in traditional medicine and as a food source in some regions. The botanical features of D. matsudae make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
